summary: In 2007, Mexico and the United States created the Mérida Initiative, a partnership to address crime and violence and enhance the rule of law in Mexico. From fiscal year 2014 through 2018, the State Department and the U.S. Agency for International Development allocated about $723 million for the initiative. State projects included training and assistance for Mexican justice sector, military, law enforcement, and border security...
title: U.S. Assistance to Mexico: State and USAID Allocated over $700 Million to Support Criminal Justice, Border Security, and Related Efforts from Fiscal Year 2014 through 2018
